column2: MONTANA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Montana
column6: MT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Buggy warning
column6: Stop ahead
column8: Low shoulder

column2: 2. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column4: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column6: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column8: Construction and maintenance warning.

column2: 3. Which of the following may result in an arrest for driving under the influence of intoxicants (DUII)?
column4: An inhalant, such as glue or paint.
column6: Alcohol
column8: A controlled substance, such as prescription medicines or illegal drugs.

column2: 4. Braking distance is affected by:
column4: the speed your vehicle is traveling.
column6: pavement conditions.
column8: the condition of your brakes and tires.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: No U-turn
column8: Winding road ahead

column2: 6. Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
column4: passing is not allowed.
column6: passing is allowed if you are at the top of a hill.
column8: passing is allowed for both drivers.
column10: passing is allowed during daylight only.

column2: 7. When you are driving, turning your head and looking before changing lanes is:
column4: unnecessary, you should use your rearview mirror instead.
column6: a good driving habit.
column8: prohibited.

column2: 8. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: there's an intersection ahead.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 9. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 10. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop.
column6: slow down and enter the intersection.
column8: signal other vehicles to stop.
column10: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 11. A few drinks after work before driving home:
column4: should be avoided unless you really need them.
column6: are acceptable as far as they are part of your daily routine.
column8: should be avoided because they impair your judgement.
column10: have no effect on your driving ability.

column2: 12. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column6: race on empty roads.
column8: share the lane with another vehicle.
column10: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way
column6: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Do not enter

column2: 14. When passing other vehicles, drivers should:
column4: apply the brake and slow down.
column6: make sure the passing lane is clear of traffic, and check behind and to the left to make sure another vehicle is not attempting to pass.
column8: pass the vehicle as slowly as possible.

column2: 15. When changing lanes on an interstate, drivers should:
column4: stop in the breakdown lane if they are tired.
column6: use cruise control to increase traction whenever possible.
column8: change lanes often.
column10: signal and check mirrors and blind spots.

column2: 16. Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians when:
column4: pedestrians are crossing the road in marked crosswalks.
column6: pedestrians are crossing at an intersection without a traffic light and without a crosswalk.
column8: All of the above.
column10: the driver is turning a corner and pedestrians are crossing with the light.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: Left turns are permitted
column8: No U-turns
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column6: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column8: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated
column10: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed

column2: 19. __________________ give you right-of-way to make a left turn.
column4: A flashing red light
column6: A green arrow pointing left
column8: A flashing yellow light

column2: 20. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: speed up and take the nearest exit.
column6: slow down and keep moving in your lane.
column8: pull to the curb and stop.

column2: 21. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: to know when it is safe to cross.
column6: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column8: not to cross unless they are with an adult.
column10: to suddenly run into the street.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column4: Low ground railroad crossing
column6: Winding road ahead
column8: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 23. Warning signs are normally:
column4: yellow.
column6: blue.
column8: green.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Stop if necessary
column6: Lane ends
column8: Railroad Warning

column2: 25. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column6: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column8: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.

column2: 26. If you drive much slower than the posted speed limit you:
column4: are a defensive driver.
column6: might cause a crash.
column8: are driving safely and can avoid tailgaters.
column10: always have the right of way.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: School zone ahead
column6: School crossing
column8: Pedestrians must yield to bicycles

column2: 28. The sign in the picture:
column4: means that you need to stop.
column6: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column8: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column10: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.

column2: 29. An aggressive driver:
column4: weaves in and out of traffic.
column6: shows little or no respect for traffic laws.
column8: competes with other traffic.

column2: 30. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column6: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Wrong Way
column10: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection

column2: 32. When are you allowed to drink alcoholic beverages in a vehicle on a public highway?
column4: Only if you ride in the back of a pick-up truck.
column6: Only if you ride in the back seat.
column8: As long as you don’t drive.

column2: 33. To avoid crashes with vehicles in your blind spots, you should:
column4: quickly turn your head to see if your blind spot is clear, before changing lanes.
column6: sound your horn right before turning or changing lanes.
column8: adjust your rear-view mirrors every few minutes.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column6: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Wrong Way
column10: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection

column2: 32. When are you allowed to drink alcoholic beverages in a vehicle on a public highway?
column4: Only if you ride in the back of a pick-up truck.
column6: Only if you ride in the back seat.
column8: As long as you don’t drive.

column2: 33. To avoid crashes with vehicles in your blind spots, you should:
column4: quickly turn your head to see if your blind spot is clear, before changing lanes.
column6: sound your horn right before turning or changing lanes.
column8: adjust your rear-view mirrors every few minutes.
